schema: Type of work and contribution of Crowd

Paper_1: Increased financial incentives increase the quantity, but not the quality, of work performed by participants.
Paper_2: Dynamic pricing mechanism with optional bonuses to incentivize workers to produce good performance.
Paper_3: Not directly applicable as the paper focuses on a talking application for mobile phones
Paper_4: Not directly applicable as the paper focuses on synchronous crowds
Paper_5: Not directly applicable as the paper focuses on realtime crowdsourcing
Paper_6: Not directly applicable as the paper focuses on a mechanism to incentivize agents who predict their own future actions
Paper_7: Not directly applicable as the paper focuses on a worker's own effort in completing a task
Paper_8: Paying crowd workers for collaborative work
Paper_10: Gamified crowdsourcing system that acquires new knowledge from users
Paper_11: Investigation into how small amounts of entertainment can improve crowd workers' experiences
Paper_13: Predicting worker engagement in online crowdsourcing
Paper_14: Modeling crowdsourcing as all-pay auctions with incomplete information

Paper_1: Experimental study on Mechanical Turk on the effect of compensation on performance
Paper_2: Study and analysis of a dynamic pricing mechanism for crowdsourcing tasks
Paper_3: Field deployment of a talking application for mobile phones that offers a new alternative to answering visual questions
Paper_4: Use of synchronous crowds for on-demand, realtime crowdsourcing
Paper_5: Analytic methods for optimizing realtime crowdsourcing
Paper_6: Mechanism to incentivize agents who predict their own future actions
Paper_7: Characterization of a family of scoring rules for worker and manager
Paper_8: Study of how to motivate groups of workers by paying them equitably
Paper_9: Data generated as a side effect of game play also solves computational problems and trains AI algorithms
Paper_10: Gamified crowdsourcing system that simultaneously assesses the knowledge of users and acquires new knowledge from them
Paper_11: Experimental study of how diversions containing small amounts of entertainment can improve crowd workers' experiences
Paper_12: A fast and reliable crowdsourcing framework
Paper_13: Statistical model to predict the attention and time, or engagement, invested by crowd workers
Paper_14: Analysis of a model in which users select among, and subsequently compete in, a collection of contests offering various rewards.
